p: Outcomes were reported in terms of efficacy as follows: 1) Markedly effective: patients underwent full recovery or exhibited significant improvements in their clinical symptoms; levels of ALT, AST, GGT, TBIL and other basic indicators of liver function were restored to within the normal range. 2) Effective: moderate improvement of clinical symptoms, signs and liver function. 3) Ineffective: no obvious improvement or exacerbation of symptoms, signs and liver function indexes.
